title: Typographic Munich. Advices.
content:
Hi,

I’m planning a short trip to Munich.  
Can I ask for your advice for typographic things to visit?  
Esp. specialized bookstores or may be museums?

Thanks

 [‹ A deeply unimportant question](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828112257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42174 "Go to previous forum topic") [Freight Micro for headlines ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828112257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42241 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ingap

comments.content:
not specifically typographic, but the Deutsches Museum there is sort of their Smithsonian or British Museum- an amazing collection of cultural artifacts.  
i remember a wall covered with one working example of every variety of piano keyboard mechanism ever made.

when i was there they had a special exhibit on color and the chemistry of pigments. fascinating place.

They are not strictly typographic, but you could also try to get your hands on one of Pierre Mendell’s wonderful posters for the Munich Bayerische Staatsoper.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828112257im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Mendell_4577.gif)

Hi Inga,  
check out [Typographische Gesellschaft München](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828112257/http:/www.tgm-online.de/tgm/).  
F
